data.text:
Obituaries

View Visitation & Service details >

Randy L. Barnett, 54

June 02, 2019

Randy Lee Barnett, 54, of Willow Street, passed away suddenly of natural causes at home on Sunday, June 2, 2019. Born in Columbia, Randy was the son of Beatrice (Graham) Barnett and the late Samuel Barnett. He was the loving husband of Lori A. (Smith) Barnett, with whom he recently celebrated 32 years of marriage.

Randy proudly served in the US Marines and upon his honorable discharge, went to work for East Coast Propeller Service, Lititz, where he was General Manager.

Of the Christian faith, Randy attended the Washington Boro Church of God. Randy was an outdoorsman who enjoyed hunting and fishing. He was a skilled woodworker. More than anything else, Randy loved his family and enjoyed spending time with them.

In addition to his mother and wife, Randy is survived by four children: Josh Barnett, fiancé of Brandy Spriggle, of Lititz; Joseph Barnett, of Willow Street; Jacob Barnett, fiancé of Brynn Keeney, of Lititz; and Abby Barnett, of Willow Street. He was the grandfather of Tori Broadwater.

Memorial Services for Randy will be private and at the convenience of the family.

Leave a condolence on this Memorial Page

Condolences to the Family

Lori and family, there are no words to comfort you at this tme of such grief. All of us at Winner Aviation was shocked and saddened to hear of Randy’s passing. Lori, you and Randy have always been a pleasure to work with. He will be missed. May our Lord bless you and hold you. Judy.

My thoughts and prayers are with you now and in the days and months to come. Randy was a classmate and Friend.

shelly stekervetz jacobs

Prayers to family.

Xoxo

Candy huber patterson

So sorry to hear of your loss.

James D Martin

Lori, Josh, Joseph, Jacob and Abby

May you find comfort in knowing Randy loved each of you deerley and strove his life to make it a better place for all of you. Cherish all the memories of him for the rest of your lives and continue to carry on all of your traditions knowing he will be there watching over all of you.

Semper Fi Randy Barnett You will be deepy missed

Donna Kurtz

Truly was a shock to hear my cousin has been called home to paradise! You never know when; but do know where you will spend eternity when you accept the Lord into your heart. I am sure Randy had a HUGE homecoming with all the family and friends already there … so until the family chain is linked back together again … you hunt the streets of Glory! 🙏🇺🇸💜 John 5:24, John 14:23, Luke 23:43, Rev 21:4

May God continue to comfort the family! 🙏

Love ya,

Cousin Carol Osborne & Family
